result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (E/F/G/H/I or unclassified felony/not life)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laura A. Shidell

records.addlTxt:
for Dismissal Without Prejudice
Routed to Judge's JA

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 1:54 PM/ RM 301, 22CF187 & 21CF113.  Defendant Laura A. Shidell in court.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history's. Court notes previous activity in 21CF113, Def. has filed motion to dismiss and motion request for bond modification, will track along as a status conference. 21CF113, Def. is representing herself and would like to continue to do so in 22CF187. State notes no victim in 21CF187. Court reviews waiver of attorney form with Def. Def. wishes to continue without counsel. State requests to review written waiver of attorney form as well. Court orders Def. to complete written waiver of attorney form. Court goes off record and will re call later today. 

Court recalls @ 2:14 PM/ RM 301. Appearances are the same as before. Court has received a written waiver of attorney form in and notes form will be electronically filed later today. Court reviews waiver of attorney form with Def. and Def. advised of rights. State is satisfied. Court accepts waiver of right to counsel. Def. waives time limits to P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits. Court acknowledges Def. request to modify bond and cannot modify today as needs to be seen Judge Rhode. Def. gives remarks regarding modification request. Court advises Def. to contact Judges JA to schedule bond modification hearing. Preliminary Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 1:00 PM.

No contact with Nicholas Winters.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

1:13 PM /Room 203. Defendant Laura A. Shidell appeared by video, in custody at the Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Both appearances are by Zoom. Court advises Def. of how hearing will proceed. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own, court appointed atty. State heard on bond, recommends $2,500 cash bond with conditions no contact with Nicholas Winters and no illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Def heard on bond. Remarks by the Court. The Court orders $1,800 cash bond with conditions no contact with Nicholas Winters and No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination
